result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon Marie Bloedorn

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shannon Marie Bloedorn in court.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of the complaint and his/her right to be represented by counsel. Rights explained.  Not guilty plea(s).   The previously furnished bond in this matter is amended to change the no contact provision to be no assaultive contact with D.L.W. dob: 10-09-1989.  Any other conditions will remain as originally ordered.
Offer deadline: 11-04-2022

Letter from victim.
(sent up to Br. 3)

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 09-06-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of battery-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-29-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she have no contact with D.L.W., DOB: 10-09-1989, except phone contact.  The Court will allow a one time contact with the residence, with the aid of law enforcement, after the 72 hour no contact provision has expired, to obtain personal belongings.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTSO.
Minutes.
